CareerCard.Title: Network Engineer
CareerCard.Overview: A Network Engineer is responsible for the design, implementation, and management of computer networks that support in-house voice, data, video, and wireless network services. They play a crucial role in ensuring network connectivity, troubleshooting issues, and maintaining the security of networks, making their work essential for the smooth operation of business communications.

Benefits: High demand for skilled professionals in a growing field.
Opportunities for continuous learning and certifications.
Potential for remote work and flexible hours.
Job Challenges: Can require on-call availability outside of regular hours.
Intense focus on troubleshooting may lead to stress.
Constant need to stay updated with rapidly changing technologies.
May involve repetitive tasks and documentation work.

Dual Impact Highlights.Personal Growth: This career enhances problem-solving skills and technical knowledge, fostering resilience and adaptability in a technology-driven world.
Dual Impact Highlights.Community Impact: Network Engineers contribute to the infrastructure that connects communities, enabling access to information and resources, which ultimately strengthens local economies and supports educational initiatives.

Level1ScenarioCards.Title: Initial Challenge 1
Level1ScenarioCards.Description: As a new Network Engineer, you are tasked with setting up a basic local area network (LAN) for a small office.

DecisionCards.Option A: Consult with a senior engineer for guidance on best practices.

DecisionCards.Option B: Attempt to configure the network independently based on online tutorials.

Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +Potential risks if network configuration is incorrect.

Level2ScenarioCards.Title: Advanced Challenge 1
Level2ScenarioCards.Description: You are tasked with upgrading the network infrastructure for a large corporation to improve performance and security.

DecisionCards.Option A: Implement a new VLAN configuration to optimize traffic flow and security.

Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +Secure data handling and improved service delivery to clients.

DecisionCards.Option B: Contemplate a complete network overhaul using the latest technology.

Outcomes.PersonalImpact: +Gain recognition as an innovator in your field.
Outcomes.CommunityImpact: +Upgrade community connectivity and efficiency but with higher risks and costs.
